page.title: 10HOUSING DEVELOPMENT
page.content: All coastal adjacent sites in Frinton-on-sea and Walton-on-Naze have been filled,with the exception of the Greensward,and development is also restricted to the north of Walton by the marshes,which prevent further construction. Most of the inland building sites which are available are being utilised. The area is experiencing much recent housing development and its associated pressures. Frinton's expansion external to the railway gates includes the present day estates of Heronsgate,Walden Way,Newport Way,Rochford Way and Branscombe Close. Estate developments in Walton, such as Rainham Way, Butchers Lane and Wade Reach, reached 8 units per acre, many of these being bungalows, as opposed to the 6 units per acre in Frinton.
